website_summaries.verdict: An attractive, solidly built 15.6-inch thin laptop with overall good performance, the Asus VivoBook V551LB-DB71T is held back by its lackluster display.
pros: The Asus VivoBook V551L is a thin, attractive, and seemingly well-constructed laptop
Its midrange discrete graphics card and 4th-gen Core i7 processor give it overall very good performance and battery life
And it has a 1TB hard drive and DVD burner
cons: For the V551LB's near-$1,000 price, the screen is pretty disappointing, as is its slow-spinning hard drive
Also, its keyboard is not backlit, which, again, for the price it should have

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus VivoBook V551LB-DB71T desktop replacement laptop is deceptively sleek and slim, offering category leading performance and battery life that will carry you through the day.
pros: Intel Core i7-4500U processor and Nvidia GeForce GT740 graphics for category leading performance

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed that it hasn't held up
customer_reviews.text: It's 2017 and after only 4 years of relatively light and stationary use, this computer has failed me. It's dust magnet, the keys stick, and the biggest issue is that the audio jack has stopped working for no reason. I want to reiterate that i used this lightly - no moving, banging, and only used indoors. I'm disappointed that it hasn't held up. The ram also wasn't enough - when all i did was have itunes and a browser open, it would freeze. Next time I'll go more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is bad. the product is so bad
customer_reviews.text: please don't buy it. Customer service is bad. the product is so bad. it has many errors. I'm not sure if all Asus sucks, but after buying this expensive laptop and having to pay $400 to fix it twice (due to it's errors no physical damage done), I hate it don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: HaeSuk Lee-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Decent average laptop, if you can get past the display resolution
customer_reviews.text: Vivobook V551LB, I guess it's a mid range. Storage - 500GB, RAM - Enough. The screen resolution is the worst! This computer came packed with decent ram, an i7 4th gen, and decent hard drive space. it is a touch screen laptop, no backlit keyboard. It's not too heavy, but the screen resolution kills it. Display resolution is 1366 x 768. If you can get past that, then it's a good buy. Hard drive is SATA, not SSD. Preloaded with Windows 8, minimal junk software.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: the hardware is amazing..
customer_reviews.text: the hardware is amazing...very good, however windows 8 still has issues... i have done all the upgrades and updates and finally i have less bugs but still sometimes it will not switch off or would become non responsive. the touch is very good, just like on my asus tablet. oerall, the laptop looks very good, elegant and slim and the battery will go over 4 hours. only thing that is missing is the backlit keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian R.

customer_reviews.title: I love ASUS products
customer_reviews.text: I love ASUS products. I did have to get the screen fixed, but I have been thoroughly satisfied. This laptop doesn't fall apart like the 3 Dell Laptops I have had since high school and I am in my last year in college. Fast charging and the quality of the PC isn't cheap. If I buy another PC in the next 3 years it'll definitely be an ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop, thin
customer_reviews.text: Excelente laptop, delgada, bastante rápida, buena tarjeta de video, lo necesario para aplicaciones que lo requieran y video juegos. Solo tuve problemas al actualizar a windows 8.1 ya que al parecer tenia algún tipo de incompatibilidad con las tarjetas de video (intel/nvidia). Excellent laptop, thin, pretty fast, good video card, necessary for applications that require it and video games. I only had problems when upgrading to windows 8.1 because apparently had some kind of incompatibility with the video card (intel / nvidia).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. OCS

customer_reviews.title: Very good laptop gets job done
customer_reviews.text: Aweasome laptop, does everything from games ( GTA V its child's play) to work, i have it now for 2 years, only thing i'm upgraded it's ssd at very begining ( loads in 8 sec from cold), works like boss, only con is it's screen resolution. Overall very good purchase having in mind that i paid about 750$ to door years ago, and now its price even bigger. Conclusion is good laptop - good value for your money...
customer_reviews.author: Dainus11

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop, the screen resolution is quite low for ...
customer_reviews.text: Good laptop, the screen resolution is quite low for a 15" but it does the job. I replaced the 5400RPM HDD with a 1TB SSD and now I have the best laptop I've had, by far.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for about a week now, but so far it is great. The touch screen is a must if you are going to have Windows 8 operating system. The graphics are good and the speed is excellent. I am not much for gaming, but my son is and he put a couple games on here and they are smooth and clear. This is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Esposito

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the computer itself
customer_reviews.text: I have had this computer for a year and a half now. I know nothing about technology and did a lot of research prior to buying this computer. I am very pleased with the computer itself. The only issue I have ran into is the charger could have been constructed differently. The prongs that plug into the wall are weak.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah  Schaub

customer_reviews.title: New ASUS touchscreen laptop
customer_reviews.text: It was recommended by someone whom I trust, who is more knowledgeable about the latest technology and I have been very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Provost

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it!!!!. It has all the features -plus.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose as a computer but for $700 I would have expected more. It is the slowest i7 processor I have ever seen. Buy a different computer. Or even better put the money towards building a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Kellner Wehrman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Every aspect very very impressive. Won't find a better computer on the market. The only downside is that the screen is bright, but not super bright. But could be all touchscreen computers i'm not sure. Loving every minute with it
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Flawless and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Nice and fast like gaming laptop. No issues for the last 4 months.

customer_reviews.title: Just horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend anyone to buy this laptop. The laptop freezes every time I want to watch a youtube video longer than ~20 minutes, it shuts down randomly (2-3 times a day) and you can't watch HD movies with both of the graphic boards... Horrible!!

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and is very fast. Love the touch screen. Just need to offer office with this product to make it complete

customer_reviews.title: I love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop! It's super fast and the screen resolution is crystal clear. Love the touch function. Wish the mouse pad wasn't so big, but it's a great machine!

customer_reviews.title: ill do an in depth review later when i have time but amazing laptop!
customer_reviews.text: ill do an in depth review later when i have time but amazing laptop! It is everything I could ever want!

customer_reviews.title: old-school user friendly
customer_reviews.text: a little heavy for carting around, but love the keyboard feel and the speed, also the screen format options. i always thought i should stick to big-name brands and much preferred old-style mouse-n-keyboard...but this lil lappie is very comfortable even for an old puter curmudgeon like me.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Asus, I just wish it was 17inches

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a good laptop, look no further my friends
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is my life. I'm using this laptop to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: I give this laptop a 4 instead of a 5 because its almost perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is sort of a hasty review...I give this laptop a 4 instead of a 5 because its almost perfect for my needs. So far so good, and i think it will stay this way for a while. If this is your first time getting a laptop with windows 8 or 8.1, then it will take a little while to become adjusted to the new setup. But again, im loving it so far, and really, for a college student, you wont need anything better than this.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Didn't take a charge right out of the box, awful product. Would not recommend this to anyone. Stay away from this.

customer_reviews.title: my portable work station with style
customer_reviews.text: everything perfect expect: screen quality not the best - sucks if you hook up to full hd tv thinking about replacing the hard drive to a solid state for max performance
customer_reviews.author: joanna868

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, power and ease.
customer_reviews.text: This notebook offers tremendous specs...is very comfortable to use...and I am thrilled with it! Replaces my old desktop. I also use Stardock to return this homescreen to Win XP 7 like useage. Understand win 8.1 may be corrects this.
customer_reviews.author: RR_KC

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with model, but not service.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good laptop, and it's probably one of the best ones you can buy, but I got mine broken and glitchy and instead of replacing it they refunded it minus 200$ processing charges; so I'd buy it from someone else if you were to get it, honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: the laptop is a crap, the wireless network card doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: the laptop is a crap ,the wireless network card doesnt work , i got another cheap laptop ando works better laptop asus

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong !
customer_reviews.text: I love it . Great buy, plain and simple ! A bit heavy, and could use faster rpm hard drive, but other than that. No regrets

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: Very fast great graphics and lighter than I expected. Touch screen is very convenient and useful. Best quality for your dollar.

customer_reviews.title: really nice but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: very good computer. the processor is nice and setting the gpu to certain programs it's helpful for battery life. the Wi-Fi seems unreliable to me and doesn't perform well enough for my online game. asus Windows 8 recovery is terrible and causes half my difficulty

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hardware, speedy performance, amazing battery life! The new intel chip (4th gen) does this machine justice. Only weak point is the sound output underwhelms.
customer_reviews.author: G. Shia

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Laptop and Service pls dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: The laptop delivered to me was having many issues namely :- 1. Crashed with blue screen. 2. Internet Drop connection. 3. PC slowness when performing programming task.(As compared to my older PC which has lower configuration). The PC was returned to the seller but they are not ready to accept the issue and deducted 10% of the cost. NOT HAPPY with the reseller, I am a Computer S/W engineer and know when the computer has actual issue. I wish I had not bought it in first place.
customer_reviews.author: GABBAR

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after a week!
customer_reviews.text: After having this laptop for only a week, the computer failed to power on. I contacted ASUS for repairs and they had me ship it back to them. However, after three weeks, I still have not received the computer back. Beginning to wonder why I paid so much for this to have it only a week and then not be able to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 weeks the computer would not power on. Sent to ASUS for repair. Came back in 2 weeks. 2 weeks later, same issue. Now on hold for the past 18 minutes waiting to speak to a human.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Poor spare part availability. Cannot find a batterry.
customer_reviews.text: I am running into a battery problem for this laptop. It has less than 3 months, but the batterry is falling to charge. I am looking for a replacement. But I cannot find the right battery for it.
customer_reviews.author: Oumar Doucoure

customer_reviews.title: wireless sucks
customer_reviews.text: The wireless network card is crap. I've had nothing but trouble with it since I got the laptop. I am so disappointed. I wish I had bought something else. Should've bought a Dell...
customer_reviews.author: TLS

customer_reviews.title: keyboard stopped working
customer_reviews.text: in computer science classes and they keyboard doesnt work after 2 weeks. Nothing spilled on it just stopped. Now i lug around another keyboard for a brand new lap top....ghetto. past time for amazon to take it back need it for school so cant send it to asus asked asus if i did if there was anyway i could get a replacement b/c of being in classes they said no it would have to be fixed poor form asus
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Last Year's Model
customer_reviews.text: I feel doped. Mouse issues. I went to a store, found the computer i wanted, ordered it online, i got this one... Last years model. the return kicked back to me. to late to return it now. Sad day.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jordan Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Screen cracks and touch screen stops responding a little over a month after purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Of course, being able to return to Amazon expired a mere week before this happened! Laptop closed - when reopened several cracks in screen ad touch screen not responding. What the ##@)$#?(*&^%!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Stepnowski

customer_reviews.title: It's not touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: The title says touch screen but my laptop is not. I don't care for touch screen in the first place but just so people know, there is no touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Windows 8, no!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because my husband wanted a touch screen laptop. Unfortunately, Windows 8 is a horrible operating system and makes us want to cry. The hardware itself is fine - another quality ASUS product - but the horror that is Windows 8 makes this laptop a punishment to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Dork

customer_reviews.title: immediate malware
customer_reviews.text: Within a half hour from opening the box, malware rendered the computer useless. The manufacturer should have set security settings higher on default. Returned the item. Waste of time. Got an Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Lefa A.

product_meta.title: ASUS Laptop VivoBook V551LB-DB71T Intel Core i7 4500U (1.80 GHz) 8 GB Memory 1 TB HDD NVIDIA GeForce GT 740M 15.6" Touchscreen Windows 8 64-Bit [Discontinued By Manufacturer]
product_meta.description:
The silver Vivobook V551LB-DB71T Multi-Touch 15.6" Notebook Computer from ASUS has a 15.6" widescreen display that is backlit with LED lamps, which brighten faster, use less power and provide better picture quality than their CCFL counterparts. The screen is also a touchscreen so you'll be able utilize all the multi-touch gestures incorporated into Windows 8. The screen has a true 16:9 aspect ratio, which is also the standard of HDTVs. The 1366 x 768 native resolution is supported by a NVIDIA GeForce GT 740M with 2GB of discrete memory.
The system is powered by a 4th generation Haswell dual-core 1.8GHz Intel Core i7-4500U processor. It also has 8GB of DDR3 RAM, a 1TB 5400rpm hard drive, a SuperMulti DVD burner, a SD media card reader, 10/100/1000Mbps Gigabit Ethernet, 802.11b/g/n Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0, an integrated webcam and microphone. There are also built-in stereo speakers.
Windows 8 is the installed operating system. Windows 8 replaces the traditional Start menu with a redesigned Start screen. The Start screen features tiles, which provide notifications in real-time. Windows 8 also focuses more on cloud storage as well as apps, which can be downloaded from the Windows Store. Windows 8 provides a unique user experience that differs from previous versions of Windows.




AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Intel Core i7-4500U Processor (4M Cache, up to 3.00 GHz)
3 Years of Free 32GB ASUS WebStorage, 2 USB 3.0, 1 USB 2.0, HDMI output, Bluetooth 4.0
